intro: Baphia marceliana subsp. marquesii, commonly known as the Marques' baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine due to their potential medicinal properties.
